label: 三塔
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Tōtō, Saitō, and Yokawa, collectively known as santō (three Buddhist halls"; by extension, "three compounds").  Three centers in the main valleys on Mount Hiei, each consisting of a principal hall and many lesser buildings, and together composing most of the great Enryakuji.  The Eastern Compound was the central area of the temple, the Western Compound lay to the northwest, and Yokawa was on the north (p. 538n). [東塔、西塔、横川、比叡山、延暦寺]"
